title: Korigad
snippet: Korigad is Few KM ahead of Famous "Tiger Point" in Lonavala.
fullContent:
The best time to visit Korigad Fort is September to December as the temperatures are low.During rainy season you will get the best view but it becomes risky as there will be greater chances of slipping.
But with care you can manage to trek.
It is around 20 km south of lonavala in pune district.
You will have to take Ambey valley road from lonavala to reach there.
Korigad fort has the easiest trekking route and a good start for beginners.
It feels very fascinating to go trekking through the lush green forest and also it is safe.
It took us approximately 45 minutes to reach the peak and the view was breathtaking.
There's a small lake at the center of the fort,three elegant temples which are established at the notch of the peak.
The fort depicts the legacy of Maratha cultural established by Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and later conquered by the Britishers.
Remember to carry the needful like food,water etc as there is no facility available.
There are many adventurous places around the fort like magic mountain,tiger's point,bhaja caves,sunil's celebrity wax museum etc.
Overall a very good experience....just go when the weather is pleasant and not sunny!
author: Sourabh Madane

images.prompt: This place is beautiful, as it has dense greenery and beautiful views. For beginners, the climb is also quite easy. The best part is still to come, which is seeing the valley and forts from the top, as it is stunning. This alone makes the journey meaningful.

Just below the main gate at top you will find drinking water, it's natural and you will feel that than RO water. From top of the fort you can see Ambey valley city and its airport. Surrounding Scene is greenery. At top you can get lemon water and food too for snacks. Awesome plate I'm preferring to visit once in life.
Once we reach the top it was simply awesome and the climate was perfect. Have entirely covered the fort by taking a round trip from one side to other.
Fantastic view of Lonavala region landscapes, mountains and deep valleys.

title: Lohagad Fort
snippet: Amazing ,from base approx 350 steps ,wonder ful view from top, its must visit place of you are travelling to khandala...
fullContent:
This is an excellent place for whatever reason you visit. The journey to the top was an exciting ride, with green growth and highly scenic sceneries all around to add atmosphere. The weather, Full of sunshine, made the climb memorable for its cool, fresh air.

There was a lot to see, from the vast gate leading to ancient stone walls. We walked through the area and discovered hidden caves.

All in all, this place should not be missed if anyone is looking for an intersection between nature and history. The climbing is not too difficult, and you get to see some fantastic scenery along the way. Whether you are an adventurer or historian, this place has things it can dish up just for you.
author: Sourabh Madane

images.prompt: Very easy to climb, it is only 400 stairs to see the mind blowing view, lots of monkeys are there be careful with eatables, donâ€™t take it out, if you open anything then you have to give those item to monkey. In the base of the fort you will get Maggie, vada pav, cool drinks, bread omelet and water. Bathroom facility is available in the base of the fort on payable basis. On the top well and small ponds are there, but water will not be good. On the top you will get lime juice.

Family with small kids should not attempt to climb during monsoon/rainy season.
Ideally, winter (Nov-Feb) would be bes to do so.
It is prudent to park your vehicle prior to ascending the ghats, as thare are many vehicles, which are parked in an haphazard manner, making return/downhill drive difficult, as same would be blocking your path.
Car parking facility exists at base of steps to fort.
